conversation.content: Hi, um, I know this is probably annoying but I need my account history for like...
Oh no worries at all. Let me just... what's the word... authenticate you first. Can I get your account number? It should be something like ACC followed by eight digits.
Yeah it's ACC-48291056. So basically I need everything from January?

Got it, ACC-48291056... hmm, okay so here's the thing—our system is honestly kind of a pain with historical data. I can see—no wait, let me check something else—yeah, I can pull the last 90 days pretty easily.
Er, that's not gonna... I actually need six months back if that's...
Yeah I know, it's ridiculous right? The way they designed this... ugh. So what I can do is—hold on, there's a... what do you call it... a legacy report tool. Takes forever but it goes back to 2021.
Oh thank God. Um, I hate to be that person but...

No no, seriously don't even worry about it. I'm running report ID RH-7739-X2 right now. Between you and me? Half my day is fighting with these ancient systems. Estimated completion time is showing... eesh... 4 minutes.
Sorry, I just really need this for my accountant and...
Hey listen, I totally get it. Tax season is—let me just—actually you know what? While that's running, I can also generate form 1099-MISC if you need it. Document code would be DOC-99M-2024.
Would you? That would be so...
Already on it. So the account history will have... hmm... all transactions, fees, interest earned—basically everything from January 1st. Current balance is showing $12,847.29 as of today.
Perfect. And then the payments I made in March should be...
Yep, I see those—actually wait, there's something... no that's right. Three payments in March totaling $4,500.00. Transaction IDs are TXN-3847, TXN-3901, and TXN-3955.
Okay good, so those are all there then.
Mmm-hmm. Oh and just so you know—this is kinda dumb but—the report comes in like... what's the format... CSV only. No PDF option because apparently that's too modern for us.
That's fine, er, whatever works honestly.
Cool cool. Alright so... let me see here... report's done! Sending to your email on file, the one ending in 7745. Should hit your inbox in about 30 seconds.
You're literally saving my life here, um, thank you so much.

Oh please, this is the easiest call I've had all day. Honestly refreshing to help someone who's actually nice about it. Your confirmation number for this request is REQ-20240315-KJ8. Anything else I can dig up for you?

scenario: asking for a detailed account history going back several months
